chain_of_thought_reasoning: To find the user with the highest bounty amount for the vote type of 8, I need to filter the 'votes' table to include only rows where VoteTypeId is 8. From there, I can find the maximum 'BountyAmount' using an ORDER BY clause. Once I have the highest bounty amount, I will join the 'users' table to get the DisplayName and WebsiteUrl of the user who received this bounty amount. The join will be based on the UserId in the votes table. I only need to select DisplayName and WebsiteUrl of this user. According to the database admin instructions, I will only include relevant columns in the SELECT clause and ensure that any joins are clearly defined using aliases. Finally, I will process the query to ensure it meets the specified conditions and outputs the correct information.
SQL: SELECT U.DisplayName, U.WebsiteUrl FROM votes V INNER JOIN users U ON V.UserId = U.Id WHERE V.VoteTypeId = 8 ORDER BY V.BountyAmount DESC LIMIT 1
SELECT U.DisplayName, U.WebsiteUrl FROM votes V INNER JOIN users U ON V.UserId = U.Id WHERE V.VoteTypeId = 8 ORDER BY V.BountyAmount DESC LIMIT 1

sql_generation.Question: Under the vote type of 8, provide the display names and websites URLs of the user who got the highest bounty amount.
sql_generation.Evidence: vote type of 8 refers to VoteTypeId = 8; the highest bounty amount refers to MAX(BountyAmount);
sql_generation.pred_sql: SELECT U.DisplayName, U.WebsiteUrl FROM votes V INNER JOIN users U ON V.UserId = U.Id WHERE V.VoteTypeId = 8 ORDER BY V.BountyAmount DESC LIMIT 1
sql_generation.gold_sql: SELECT DisplayName, WebsiteUrl FROM users WHERE Id = ( SELECT UserId FROM votes WHERE VoteTypeId = 8 ORDER BY BountyAmount DESC LIMIT 1 )
